metadata.name: Port Forwarding Activity Via SSH.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects port forwarding activity via SSH.exe

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\ssh.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -r ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /r ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' –r ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' —r ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ―r '))))

output.summary: Detects port forwarding activity via SSH.exe

metadata.objective: False positive: Administrative activity using a remote port forwarding to a local port Reference: https://www.absolomb.com/2018-01-26-Windows-Privilege-Escalation-Guide/
